title: Unified Multimodal LLM Matches Human Reasoning Across Domains
excerpt: Researchers at OpenAI released M3L, a multimodal language model that integrates text, vision, and audio, achieving human-level performance on a new cross-modal reasoning benchmark.

title: Self-Supervised ViT Attains 90% ImageNet Accuracy Without Labels
excerpt: A new self-supervised Vision Transformer, SSViT, learns representations from unlabeled images and surpasses 90% top-1 accuracy on ImageNet, challenging supervised learning dominance.

title: Embodied AI Robot Master Tool Use via Reinforcement Learning
excerpt: The Stanford Robotics Lab demonstrated a kitchen robot that learns to use a knife and spatula by reinforcement learning, achieving efficient task completion without hand-crafted demonstrations.

title: Meta-RL Algorithm Solves 200 Tasks in Minutes with Few Samples
excerpt: A new meta-reinforcement learning framework, QuickAdapt, adapts to 200 diverse simulated environments in under five minutes, requiring only a few dozen interactions per task.

title: OpenAI Launches LLM-ChatEval 2.0 Benchmark with 1M Conversations
excerpt: LLM-ChatEval 2.0 provides a large-scale, crowdsourced evaluation suite for conversational agents, covering 1 million human-model dialogues across 50 domains.

title: Google Vertex AI Deploys LLM for Real-Time Medical Diagnosis

title: NeRF-Based 3D Reconstruction Achieves 0.5% Error on Real-World Dataset
excerpt: A novel Neural Radiance Field variant, AccurateNeRF, reconstructs high-fidelity 3D scenes from single-view images with only 0.5% mean error on the RealWorld3D benchmark.

title: Sparse Prompting Cuts LLM Inference Cost by 70% Without Accuracy Loss
excerpt: Researchers introduced SparsePrompt, a technique that selects a minimal set of keywords to steer large language models, reducing token usage and inference cost by 70% while maintaining performance.
